verse.name: v1
verse.lines: On a hill far away stood an old rugged cross, The emblem of suff’ring and shame, And I love that old cross where the Dearest and Best For a world of lost sinners was slain.

verse.name: c1
verse.lines: So I’ll cherish the old rugged cross, Till my trophies at last I lay down; I will cling to the old rugged cross, And exchange it some day for a crown.

verse.name: v2
verse.lines: Oh, that old rugged cross, so despised by the world, Has a wondrous attraction for me; For the dear Lamb of God left His glory above, To bear it to dark Calvary.

verse.name: v3
verse.lines: In the old rugged cross, stained with blood so divine, A wondrous beauty I see; For ’twas on that old cross Jesus suffered and died, To pardon and sanctify me.

verse.name: v4
verse.lines: To the old rugged cross, I will ever be true Its shame and reproach gladly bear Then he'll call me someday to my home far away Where his glory forever I'll share.
